required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of a Modified Minimally Invasive Esophagectomy
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of a Modified Minimally Invasive Esophagectomy

brief_summary.textblock: This is a retrospective case series of a novel fully minimally invasive esophagectomy procedure for patients with primary esophageal cancer.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 2.9 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Intensive care unit length of stay
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 2.9 years
secondary_outcome.description: Intensive care unit length of stay

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with inpatient mortality
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 2.9 years
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with inpatient mortality

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with hospital readmission within 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with hospital readmission within 30 days

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Hospital stay and 30 days post discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with medical and surgical complications both inpatient and post-discharge

arm_group.description: Patients who underwent minimally invasive esophagectomy with this novel procedure at Kaiser Permanente, Northern California, Oakland Medical Center

intervention.description: Esophagectomy using a novel fully minimally invasive approach

study_pop.textblock: Consecutive sample of all patients undergoing the novel minimally invasive esophagectomy procedure at the Kaiser Permanente Northern California Oakland Medical Center during the study period

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patient with primary esophageal cancer of any cell type
- underwent the novel minimally invasive esophagectomy procedure at the Kaiser Permanente Northern California Oakland Medical Center by one of the study author-surgeons
Exclusion Criteria:
- non-elective procedure
- less than 90 days of post-discharge follow-up
